*Rules and corrections For both pop overs*

# -add close icon button-
# -reduce interline space for text "the higher...."-
# slider: add the other circles/steps (as per mock up)

# -reduce interline space and size tex (12 px) of text below slider-
# -reduce size text bottom (12px)-
# -buttons must be inside pop over-

# if user clicks outside pop over, the pop over closes

# -when resizing the page, the pop over must stay attached to the button that opened it (currently floating)-

 

-->- *-pop over for Global tuning:-* -KPI prediction- +-global-+ -tuning- 

* -complete text below slider: :- 

-"Modifications will override the single KPI settings.-

  -Changes will be applied after next retrain"-

-->- *-pop over for SINGLE KPI tuning:-* -KPI prediction tuning- 

* -correct title: "KPI prediction tuning"-
* -remove "global" from title)-

fields.summary: Filters Apply Across All Tabs Instead of Independently
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to any of the following tabs: Agent Catalog, AI Agents, Package, or Credential.
# Apply a filter using the Classification filter, Search bar, or Status checkboxes.
# Switch to the other tabs.
# Observe that the same filter is applied in all tabs instead of only the one where it was applied.

*Actual Result*
Filters are applied across all tabs when applied in any single tab.

*Expected Result*
Each tab should apply filters independently without affecting the others.

fields.summary: Duplicate Scroll Bar Displayed for All categories filter in both the Agent Catalog and AI Agents Page
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Agent Catalog* page or *AI Agents* page.
# Expand the *All libraries* section.
# Observe the presence of two scroll bars:

*Actual Result*
Two scroll bars are displayed on the same line when expanding the All libraries section.

*Expected Result*
Only one scroll bar should be displayed.

fields.summary: Extra "Save" button still appears after creating an agent from template
User not redirected to AI Agent page after creating agent from template
"Save Changes" button shows error and changes to "Save" button when selecting previously configured LLM in edit mode
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Edit Agent* page.
# Select the *previously configured LLM* from the dropdown.
# Observe that the *Save Changes* button is enabled.
# Click the *Save Changes* button.
# An *error message* appears.
# Close the error message.
# Notice that the button now appears as *Save* instead of *Save Changes*.
# Click the *Save* button → The agent updates successfully.

*Actual Result:*

* Error message appears on clicking *Save Changes*.
* Button label changes to *Save* after dismissing the error.
* Clicking *Save* updates the agent with the previous value.

*Expected Result:*

* The Save Changes button should only be enabled when the LLM value is modified. If the user re-selects the previously configured LLM, the button must remain disabled, consistent with the behavior of other fields.

fields.summary: Template page flickers momentarily when navigating to AI Agents tab
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the application.
# Navigate to any tab other than *AI Agents* (e.g., Credentials/ Packages).
# Click on the *AI Agents* tab.
# Observe the page load transition carefully.

*Actual Result:*
The *Template page flickers* momentarily before the AI Agents content loads.

*Expected Result:*
The AI Agents page should load smoothly without any flicker of the Template page.

fields.summary: Package/agents list view icons (Edit, Duplicate, Test, Delete) disabled after “Failed to fetch” error until page refresh
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Packages/agents* page in list view.
# Trigger a scenario where *“Failed to fetch”* error appears (Click on Test icon for the package/agent which has invalid tool)
# After the error appears, try clicking on:
#* *Edit* icon
#* *Duplicate* icon
#* *Test* icon
#* *Delete* icon
# Observe that none of the icons are clickable.
# Refresh the page.
# Verify that the icons become functional again after refresh.

*Expected Result:*
Action icons (*Edit, Duplicate, Test, Delete*) should remain functional even if a *“Failed to fetch”* error occurs.

*Actual Result:*
All action icons are disabled and unresponsive after the error, until the page is refreshed.

status.description: This work item was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here the work items are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Reopened

fields.summary: When applying filters in the AI Agents page, the results are inconsistent:
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Go to *AI Agents page*.
# Apply *Show also template* filter.
# Apply *In Progress* filter.
# Observe that templates appear at the top, but *Ready cards also show up incorrectly*.
# Repeat with *Show also template + Ready filter*.
# Observe that results also include *In progress* cards.

*Expected Result:*

* When *In Progress* + *Show also template* filters are applied → only _In Progress agents_ and _Templates_ should be shown.
* When *Ready* + *Show also template* filters are applied → only _Ready agents_ and _Templates_ should be shown.

*Actual Result:*

* Extra cards (_Ready_ or _In Progress_) are shown even when only one status filter is applied with templates.

status.description: This work item was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here the work items are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Reopened

fields.summary: Credential type dropdown shows "No Options" after page refresh in Create Agent flow
fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Go to *Create Agent* page.
# Refresh the page.
# Navigate to *Credential tab → Add Credential → Credential Type dropdown*.
# Observe: *"No Options"* is displayed.

*Expected Result:*

* Credential type options should be fetched and displayed correctly, even after page refresh.

*Actual Result:*

* "No Options" message is shown instead of the available credential types.

fields.summary: Implement server-side search and pagination for AI Agents listing
fields.description:
Currently, in the *AI Agents page*, the backend is making an API call to fetch only the *first 1000 agents*.

* When searching for agents within these 1000, results are shown correctly.
* When searching for agents beyond the first 1000 (e.g., the 1300th agent), results are not displayed because the backend is not queried beyond the 1000th agent.

*Enhancements:*

# *Server-side Search*
#* Search functionality should query the backend for agents beyond the first 1000.
#* Searching for any agent (e.g., 1300th) should return results without issues.
# *Pagination in UI*
#* In the UI, only *100–200 agents should be displayed at once*.
#* Additional agents should load only when the user navigates to the next pages (lazy loading / pagination).

fields.summary: Credentials Card Component - Design Alignment
fields.description:
Update the styling and markup of {{OverviewItemCard}} and {{OverviewItemRow}} to strictly adhere to the new design system guidelines. Additionally, implement performance optimizations such as memoization ({{React.memo}}) to prevent unnecessary re-renders of the individual list items or cards.

fields.summary: Refactoring Types: Implementing an Extensible Hierarchy
Ctrl+Z & Ctrl+Y - Canvas Support
fields.description: This task is a request to implement {{Ctrl+Z}} (undo) and {{Ctrl+Y}} (redo) functionality for all actions performed on the canvas. The implementation should allow users to restore or delete an action, with all changes properly reflected in the Redux store. This feature is crucial for a seamless user experience, as it allows for easy correction of mistakes without having to manually recreate or delete work.

fields.summary: UI Works - New Features
fields.description: This epic is dedicated to tracking all new features requested by stakeholders or managers. Any task categorized as a "new feature" within this epic must have its own dedicated feature branch. The owner of the feature branch must always update their branch by pulling the latest changes from the trunk branch, which is currently {{stable_ui}}.

fields.summary: UI - Responsiveness
fields.description: This epic focuses on optimizing the layout and adaptability of the main pages of the platform to ensure a consistent user experience on different devices and screen sizes.

fields.summary: UI - Code Improvements & Reworks
fields.description: This epic is dedicated to improving and refactoring existing code to optimize its quality, maintainability, and overall system performance.

fields.summary: UI - Core Functional Bugs
fields.description: This epic focuses on resolving functional bugs that compromise the platform's core functionalities. The goal is to improve the overall system stability and ensure a seamless user experience.

fields.summary: Create agent-LLM Type Field Temporarily Displays "No LLM Selected" on Page Reload
fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Navigate to the *Create New Agent* page.
# Ensure an LLM option is already selected.
# Refresh the page (e.g., press {{F5}}).
# Observe the *LLM Type field* during reload.

h3. Expected Behavior:

* The LLM Type field should *retain and display the selected value* seamlessly after reload.
* No transient placeholder or incorrect status should be shown.

h3. Actual Behavior:

* The field *briefly displays* {{"No LLM selected"}} before the actual value loads.
* The flicker may be unnoticeable in normal flow but becomes evident during testing or screen recording.

Personal notes: “per un attimo si vede No LLM selected poi si mette quello selezionato, questo perchè ci mette un pochino a caricare… vediamo cosa si può fare magari un loading qualcosa…” [~accountid:712020:7addebdd-2be3-4fb3-900c-0d05e2bc5d76]

status.description: This work item is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

fields.summary: UI - Loading and Error Management
fields.description: This Story focuses on improving the visual handling of loading states and error messages across the product. The goal is to identify all areas where loading and error visuals are missing, inconsistent, or could be improved. All tasks related to addressing these issues, such as implementing new loader designs, adding specific error messages, and ensuring visual consistency, will be tracked under this story.

status.description: This work item is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

fields.summary: Vulnerabilities Management - UI
fields.description:
We will use this story to track all the vulnerabilities on the ui at the beginning of this however we would need to create a complete Jenkins pipeline to take the Agentic UI code and do the scans

the folders are two one is "agentic-ui" and the other is "json-forms"
json-forms is a sub-library linked already from agentic-ui so we need to figure out if it is enough to scan on agentic and automatically can also see the sub-libraries of json-forms to scan or we need to do two scans

for now let's start by creating the full pipeline

fields.summary: Bottom left Canvas Navigator
fields.description:
!Screenshot 2025-03-14 alle 15.47.31.png|width=33.333333333333336%,alt="Screenshot 2025-03-14 alle 15.47.31.png"!

The navigator in the lower right should allow more controlled zooms and quick navigations:

* Map button showing the chart map. (Natively supported by GoJs just needs to be implemented) 
* button for automatic relocation of nodes in a readable way.

Useful links:

* [GoJs - Overview Element|https://gojs.net/latest/intro/overview.html]  - Gojs integrated features for navigator maps

fields.summary: Login Services - Extend Session Keeper from UnO
fields.description:
-In the future this epic will be used also for implement login manager logic (keycloak or others)-
-Implement something like this in Typescript:-

-Explore the possibility to implement also OAuth2 (Microsoft and Google). Isn't important at the moment to develop is only a exploration and study in order to be ready if we will need it.-

Currently, after a period of inactivity, UnO asks you “Are you still there?” and then lets you keep your session open or, after a little longer, logs you out.

This behavior has not been extended by us, with the result that when the session expires, the Agentic user is not aware of it.

So, for now, that task must be to extend UnO's session management to Builder as well. It shouldn't be too complex.
